# Recipe: Grill Steak Fajitas

## Table of Contents
- [Introduction](#introduction)
- [Ingredients](#ingredients)
- [Equipment](#equipment)

- [Cooking Time](#cooking-time)
- [Steps](#steps)
- [Serving Suggestions](#serving-suggestions)
- [Variations](#variations)
- [Tips and Tricks](#tips-and-tricks)
- [Nutritional Information](#nutritional-information)
- [Storage and Leftovers](#storage-and-leftovers)
- [Frequently Asked Questions](#frequently-asked-questions)

## Introduction
Grill Steak Fajitas are a popular Tex-Mex dish known for their flavorful marinated steak and colorful assortment of sautéed peppers and onions. This dish is a crowd-pleaser and perfect for gatherings or family dinners. The steak is grilled to perfection, resulting in a juicy and tender filling for the fajitas. Serve with warm tortillas and a variety of toppings for a customizable and delicious meal.

## Ingredients
- 1.5 pounds flank steak, thinly sliced
- 1 red bell pepper, sliced
- 1 green bell pepper, sliced
- 1 yellow bell pepper, sliced
- 1 large onion, sliced
- 3 tablespoons olive oil, divided
- 3 tablespoons lime juice
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 8-10 flour tortillas
- Optional toppings: sour cream, guacamole, salsa, shredded cheese, chopped cilantro

## Equipment
- Grill
- Mixing bowl
- Tongs
- Knife
- Cutting board
- Skillet or grill pan

## Preparation Time
- Marinating the steak: 1 hour

## Cooking Time
- Grilling the steak: 10-12 minutes
- Sautéing the peppers and onions: 5-7 minutes

## Steps
1. In a mixing bowl, combine 2 tablespoons of olive oil, lime juice, minced garlic, chili powder, cumin, paprika, salt, and black pepper. Whisk until well combined.
2. Place the thinly sliced flank steak in a resealable plastic bag or a shallow dish. Pour the marinade over the steak, making sure it is evenly coated. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour, or overnight for more flavor.
3. Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
4. Remove the steak from the marinade and discard any excess marinade.
5. Grill the steak for 5-6 minutes per side, or until it reaches your desired level of doneness. Remove from the grill and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing.
6. While the steak is resting, heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a skillet or grill pan over medium heat.
7. Add the sliced bell peppers and onion to the pan and sauté for 5-7 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly charred.
8. Slice the grilled steak against the grain into thin strips.
9. Warm the flour tortillas on the grill or in a dry skillet for a few seconds on each side.
10. Assemble the fajitas by placing a few slices of steak and sautéed peppers and onions onto each tortilla. Add desired toppings such as sour cream, guacamole, salsa, shredded cheese, and chopped cilantro.
11. Roll up the tortillas tightly and serve immediately.

## Serving Suggestions
- Serve the Grill Steak Fajitas with a side of Mexican rice and refried beans for a complete meal.
- Offer a variety of toppings and condiments like diced tomatoes, sliced jalapenos, and hot sauce for individuals to customize their fajitas.
- Garnish with fresh lime wedges for an extra burst of citrus flavor.

## Variations
- Chicken Fajitas: Substitute chicken breast or thighs for the steak. Marinate and grill the chicken until cooked through.
- Vegetarian Fajitas: Skip the steak and use a combination of sliced portobello mushrooms, zucchini, and yellow squash as the filling. Grill or sauté the vegetables until tender.
- Shrimp Fajitas: Replace the steak with peeled and deveined shrimp. Marinate and grill the shrimp for a few minutes on each side until pink and cooked through.

## Tips and Tricks
- Thinly slicing the steak allows for quicker and more even cooking.
- Letting the steak rest after grilling helps retain its juices and results in a more tender and flavorful meat.
- If you don't have a grill, you can cook the steak on a stovetop grill pan or broil it in the oven.
- For a spicier kick, add a pinch of cayenne pepper to the marinade.
- Make sure to heat the tortillas before serving to make them more pliable and enhance their flavor.

## Nutritional Information
- The nutritional information for Grill Steak Fajitas will vary depending on the specific ingredients and toppings used. Here is an approximate breakdown per serving (excluding toppings and tortillas):
  - Calories: 350
  - Fat: 16g
  - Protein: 30g
  - Carbohydrates: 22g
  - Fiber: 4g
  - Sugar: 8g
  - Sodium: 400mg

## Storage and Leftovers
- Store any leftover grilled steak, sautéed peppers, and onions in separate airtight containers in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
- Reheat the steak and vegetables in a skillet over medium heat until warmed through.
- Store leftover tortillas in a resealable bag or container at room temperature for up to 1 week.

## Frequently Asked Questions
1. Can I use a different cut of beef for the fajitas?
   - Yes, you can use other cuts of beef like skirt steak or sirloin for the fajitas. Adjust the cooking time accordingly as different cuts may require different cooking times.
2. Can I make the marinade in advance?
   - Yes, you can prepare the marinade in advance and store it in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. Be sure to whisk it again before using.
3. Can I use corn tortillas instead of flour tortillas?
   - Absolutely! Corn tortillas can be used as a gluten-free alternative. Warm them up on the grill or in a dry skillet before serving.
4. Can I freeze the leftover grilled steak and vegetables?
   - While it is possible to freeze the leftover steak and vegetables, the texture may change slightly upon thawing. It is best to consume them within a few days for optimal taste and texture.
